content.question: Which of the following statements correctly explains what happens to the variability of a <math alttext="t" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>t</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>-distribution as the sample size increases?

choices.label: The variability of the <math alttext="t" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>t</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>-distribution decreases as the sample size increases because the sample standard deviation approaches the population standard deviation.

The variability of the <math alttext="t" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>t</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>-distribution increases as the sample size increases because the sample standard deviation approaches the population standard deviation.

The variability of the <math alttext="t" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>t</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>-distribution increases as the sample size increases because the mean of the distribution increases.

The variability of the <math alttext="t" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>t</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>-distribution decreases as the sample size increases because the mean of the distribution decreases.

The variability of the <math alttext="t" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>t</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>-distribution remains constant as the sample size increases because the <math alttext="t" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>t</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>-statistic is defined by the sample standard deviation.

content.answer: The variability of the <math alttext="t" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>t</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>-distribution decreases as the sample size increases because the sample standard deviation approaches the population standard deviation.
